cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column from train and test
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train_df[target]

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_columns),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create model pipeline
model_pipeline = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Train model
model_pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = model_pipeline.predict(test_df)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

# Optional: Evaluate on validation set (for debugging)
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']
val_predictions = model_pipeline.predict(X_val)
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, val_predictions)
print(f"Validation

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column from train and test
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train_df[target]

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline with proper encoding and imputation
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='median'))
        ]), numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create model pipeline
model_pipeline = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Train model
model_pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = model_pipeline.predict(test_df)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions

# Save submission

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column from train and test
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train_df[target]

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline: impute first, then one-hot encode categorical
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', SimpleImputer(strategy='median'), numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create model pipeline
model_pipeline = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1))
])

# Train model
model_pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = model_pipeline.predict(test_df)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

# Optional: Evaluate on validation set (for debugging)
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
X_val = validation_df

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train_df[target]

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include='object').columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Impute numerical and categorical features
X_train_imputed = X_train.copy()
X_test_imputed = test_df.copy()

# Impute numerical features
num_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
X_train_imputed[numerical_columns] = num_imputer.fit_transform(X_train_imputed[numerical_columns])
X_test_imputed[numerical_columns] = num_imputer.transform(X_test_imputed[numerical_columns])

# Impute categorical features
cat_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
X_train_imputed[categorical_columns] = cat_imputer.fit_transform(X_train_imputed[categorical_columns])
X_test_imputed[categorical_columns] = cat_imputer.transform(X_test_imputed[categorical_columns])

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train_imputed, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test_imputed, drop_first=True)

# Align columns (handle missing dummy columns due to different feature sets)
X_train_final = X_train_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_encoded.columns.intersection(X_test_encoded.columns), fill_value=0)
X_test_final = X_test_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_encoded.columns.intersection(X_test_encoded.columns), fill_value=0)
